alert.note: Alert for Lumpkin; White (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lumpkin and White Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Camp Coleman Lake, or near Cleveland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dahlonega, Cleveland, Helen, Unicoi State Park, Whitley Gap Shelter, Robertstown, Mossy Creek, Camp Coleman Lake, Leaf, Smithgall Woods Conservation Are, Porter Springs, Turners Corner, Sautee and Qualatchee Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
